title: Nethermind clients do not mine in private aura network
body:
**Setup:** 
Private Aura network
Ubuntu 18.04 (WSL1)
1 Parity client (parity/parity:v2.7.2-stable via docker)
2 Nethermind clients (nethermind/nethermind:1.6.25-arm64 via docker)

**Procedure:**
All 3 nodes are started. They successfully connect to each other.
All 3 nodes are listed as validators in the genesis file.
Sending multiple (like 20) simple value transactions to be mined.

**Expected behavior:**
Transactions should be mined to blocks.
Some blocks should be mined by the nethermind clients.

**Actual behavior:**
All blocks are mined by the parity client.
Nethermind clients communicate following debug message (extract):

Nethermind client 1:

**Code:**
For easy reproduction of the issue, I have attached the described docker project. Simply replace the volume paths in the docker-compose.yml file and use docker-compose up to start all nodes.
On some systems, parity has some trouble with writing privilege on first start. In that case restarting the parity client should resole the issue.

For sending transactions I used the following RPC command (also included in the readme):
`curl --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"personal_sendTransaction","params":[{"from":"0x004ec07d2329997267ec62b4166639513386f32e","to":"0x00Bd138aBD70e2F00903268F3Db08f2D25677C9e","value":"0xde0b6b3a7640000"}, "user"],"id":0}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST localhost:8545
`
[Nethermind_mining_issue.zip](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/4328960/Nethermind_mining_issue.zip)
@moritz-mbw this will be picked up soon, also documentation for this is in progress
fixed although we need to prepare tests for Nethermind + Parity

Hi, @jacekv , we do support same validators (multi, list, safecontract) as parity (we do not support reporting contract yet but this is coming soon - it won't break but it won't create report transactions). So the exact config you have for parity AuRa will work on Nethermind. I need to review our docs if it says it doesn't.

Also I will review if we can't mitigate the root issue better.

@LukaszRozmej The zip file provided by @moritz-mbw contains a genesis file, as described in the first example given. Nethermind works using this genesis file, but it won't seal blocks, giving the 
`... is not proper for AuRa step X`. Once I changed the genesis file, Nethermind started to seal blocks :)
